title: Japanese Salted Salmon (Shiojake/Shiozake)
description: Enjoy tender, flavorful Japanese-style salmon with crispy skin. This classic Shiojake is lightly salted and broiled to perfection, making it perfect for rice balls, bento boxes, or a traditional Japanese breakfast. Simple to prepare, it’s a wholesome and versatile dish.

steps.instruction: If not pre-cut, slice salmon into Japanese-style fillets: skin side down, narrow tail to the left, tilt knife 30° and slice diagonally.
Brush fillets with sake and let sit 10 minutes.
Line an airtight container with paper towels. Place fillets in a single layer, cover with paper towels, repeat for remaining fillets. Refrigerate 2 days.
Preheat broiler (high, ~550°F / 288°C). Place fillets skin side up on foil-lined baking sheet.
Grate daikon and squeeze lightly to remove excess liquid. Serve alongside salmon.
Cooked salmon: fridge 3 days or freezer 2 weeks. Raw salted salmon: freezer up to 1 month.
Pat dry, then sprinkle salt evenly on both sides and the skin. Press lightly.
Broil 8–10 min until well done and flaky. No need to flip.
Alternative cooking: Bake at 425°F (218°C) for 10–12 min or grill 5 min per side over medium heat.
